intro: Smicrostigma, commonly known as the small-stigma plant, is a species within the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescence and distinctive, finely divided leaves. The plant produces tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together. Smicrostigma typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or stream banks. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and its ability to thrive in partial shade.
